properties.Title: Hurricane Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hurricane conditions from Hurricane Dorian are possible. ### A hurricane watch means that hurricane conditions are possible over parts of the region within 36 hours. Hurricane conditions include (A) sustained winds near 120 km/h or more, and/or (B) significantly elevated water levels and dangerous surf along the coast. By nature, a hurricane also implies the threat of local flooding from heavy rainfall - consult your local area forecast for possible rainfall warnings. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-08T20:59:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-08T13:30:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3084286344.2019
Area: Îles-de-la-Madeleine

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High northerly winds gusting up to 90 kilometres per hour will gradually diminish this afternoon. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Dangerous wind gusts causing widespread damage are expected or occurring. Strong southwesterly winds, with gusts reaching 120 km/h along parts of the coast, will ease below warning criteria this evening. ### Buildings under construction risk extreme damage. High winds may cause numerous downed trees and damage may occur from blowing debris. Drivers may lose control of their vehicles; tall vehicles are at high risk of being overturned. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-08T23:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-08T18:34:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1872029076.2019

properties.Title: Tropical Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Tropical storm force winds of 70 gusting to 100 km/h and possibly higher over exposed areas from Hurricane Dorian can be expected over the above regions. ### This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Shoreline erosion and wave overwash is expected where winds blow onshore. A tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions (sustained winds near 65 km/h or more) are expected over parts of the region within 24 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Tropical Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Tropical storm force winds of 70 gusting to 100 km/h and possibly higher over exposed areas from Hurricane Dorian can be expected over the above regions. Tropical storm conditions are expected as Dorian quickly approaches and moves through the region. The current track has Dorian moving ear the northern Peninsula this afternoon. Strong southwesterly winds gusting up to 110 km/h are expected, especially along coastal areas. A special weather statement is in effect for the possibility of storm surge as Dorian nears the Great Northern Peninsula ### This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Shoreline erosion and wave overwash is expected where winds blow onshore. These winds could break large tree branches resulting in downed utility lines. Some damage to signage and roof shingles may also occur. A tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions (sustained winds near 65 km/h or more) are expected over parts of the region within 24 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-09T02:59:12-00:00

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Heavy rainfall produced by post-tropical storm Dorian is still affecting Eastern Quebec. Total rainfall amounts will reach between 50 and 90 millimeters. The rain is expected to end by this afternoon over the Northeastern Gaspé Peninsula and late in the day over the Lower North Shore. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-09T03:56:19-00:00

properties.Title: Hurricane Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hurricane force winds of 90 gusting to 130 km/h at exposed locations except 120 gusting to 150 km/h at the coast with surge of 0.7 to 1.0 m and waves from 4 to 7 m from Hurricane Dorian are expected. Hurricane conditions are expected to persist early this morning as Dorian moves northeastward across the Gulf of St. Lawrence. Winds will diminish this later this morning as Dorian moves farther away. Flooding is also possible along parts of the coast due to storm surge and rough pounding surf this morning. ### These winds will topple many trees leading to downed utility lines and extended service outages. Moderate to significant damage to roofing materials, exterior cladding and light structures is likely. This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Shoreline erosion and wave overwash is expected where winds blow onshore. A hurricane warning means that hurricane conditions are expected over parts of the region within 24 hours. Hurricane conditions include (A) sustained winds near 120 km/h or more, and/or (B) significantly elevated water levels and dangerous surf along the coast. By nature, a hurricane also implies the threat of local flooding from heavy rainfall - consult your local area forecast for possible rainfall warnings. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-08T19:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-08T13:32:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2038522302.2019
Area: Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Hurricane Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hurricane force winds of 90 gusting to 130 km/h at exposed locations except 120 gusting to 150 km/h at the coast with surge of 0.7 to 1.0 m and waves from 4 to 7 m from Hurricane Dorian are expected. Hurricane conditions are expected to develop this morning as Dorian quickly approaches the region. The current track has Dorian moving over the eastern Gulf of St. Lawrence this morning and then over the northern Peninsula this afternoon. Winds gusting up to 150 km/h are expected, especially along coastal areas. ### These winds will topple many trees leading to downed utility lines and extended service outages. Moderate to significant damage to roofing materials, exterior cladding and light structures is likely. This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Shoreline erosion and wave overwash is expected where winds blow onshore. A hurricane warning means that hurricane conditions are expected over parts of the region within 24 hours. Hurricane conditions include (A) sustained winds near 120 km/h or more, and/or (B) significantly elevated water levels and dangerous surf along the coast. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.
